channel.title: Is this possible?

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:7, topic:395912”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=493098.msg3605041#msg3605041 date=1306018833]

Yes, I suppose it would be possible. You’d just have to dump the values (model id, etc) from 1610, and then set those values for the new npc.

Well, you see, thats the thing, i cant figure out how to get any of those… could i do it with an cache editor?
[/quote]

Yeah, you should be able to. I believe Tom’s cache suite had an option for adding new Npcs. Or I heard of another one by blakeman8192, the OpenRS cache lib.[/quote]
Toms cache suite… hmm… ill google that…

EDIT:
Found a download, now lets play around with it…

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:6, topic:395912”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=493098.msg3605017#msg3605017 date=1306017405]
Yes, I suppose it would be possible. You’d just have to dump the values (model id, etc) from 1610, and then set those values for the new npc.
[/quote]
Well, you see, thats the thing, i cant figure out how to get any of those… could i do it with an cache editor?[/quote]

Yeah, you should be able to. I believe Tom’s cache suite had an option for adding new Npcs. Or I heard of another one by blakeman8192, the OpenRS cache lib.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @Bumm85 Bumm85
item.description:
@Bumm85 wrote:

A bit confusing what you’re saying but you want to make a new monster which loads another npcs model?

If so do this. So where the monster models are located (depends on your cache) just find the id of the monster you want your new monster to look like and copy that model. Then say if you make a new npc with the id “1234566” change either of the copies to be named 1234566 instead of it’s original name.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

zyle1992:

So you want a new Npc, to have most of the same attributes as 1610 right?

Modelwise, so that i could assign animations server sided, etc. just like how 1610 would be.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Ok, i want to make an custom npc, kind of, uh… just read on…

Ok, so i want to edit a existing npc (1610), by lets say size, name, the attacks, HOWEVER, i still want that 1610 to stay exactly how it is, i mean, by making the edited version a new id?

like…

[code=java]if (i == 6748) {
entityDef.name = “Npcname”;
entityDef.combatLevel = 1;
entityDef.description = “Description.”;
entityDef.anInt91 = 150;
entityDef.anInt86 = 150;

[/code]
But you see, here is were my question comes into place…
how would i make it so this id loads another id’s model?
like… entityDef.loadfromid = 1610;

i know… thats not even the way to do it, thats why i’m asking, right? But just did that to make my point a little clear…

Read full topic
